lines.content: * Starting point of the Duchess chatbot.
* Handles user commands and input and responds accordingly.
* Runs main loop of Duchess chatbot.
* Reads user input, parses and executes commands and displays responses until user exits the chatbot.
this.ui.reply("Bye! See you again next time!");
throw new DuchessException("Please specify which task number to mark :(");
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! That task number does not exist :(");
this.ui.reply("Congratulations on finishing your task! Task has been marked accordingly:\n"
throw new DuchessException("Please specify which task number to unmark :(");
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! That task number does not exist :(");
"Got it! Task has been unmarked accordingly:\n"
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! Can't have a todo task without something to do :(");
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! Can't have a deadline task without a deadline :(");
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! Can't have an event task without a start and end time :(");
Task task = new EventTask(first[0], second[0], second[1]);
throw new DuchessException("Please specify which task number to delete :(");
throw new DuchessException("Oh no! That task number does not exist :(");
throw new DuchessException("Sorry! I don't know what that command means :(");
* Exception for errors in the Duchess chatbot.
* Creates a new DuchessException with the given message.
* Stores a list of tasks for the user to complete in an ArrayList.
* Adds a task to the todolist.
* @param task the task to be added
* Prints all tasks in the list in order.
* Retrieves the task with the given task number.
* @param taskNumber the number of the task to retrieve
* @return the task with the given number
* Returns the number of tasks currently in the todolist.
* Removes and returns the task with the given number.
* @param taskNumber the number of the task to remove
* Handles parsing of commands inputted by user.
* Returns the command word of the input string given by the user.
* Returns the rest of the command, without the command word.
* @return description of command without command word.
* Handles writing tasks to and fetching tasks from the hard disk.
* Fetches tasks from the hard disk and loads them into a TodoList.
* If no data file exists, an empty task list is returned.
* @return a TodoList containing all previously saved tasks.
Task eventTask = new EventTask(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
System.out.println("You don't have any existing data file, so we're starting with an empty list! :(");
* Writes all tasks in the given TodoList to the data file.
* @param todolist the task list to be written to the data file
* Represents a task to be completed by a certain deadline.
private static final DateTimeFormatter PRINT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
* Returns a string representation of this DeadlineTask to save to data file.
* where 0 means not done and 1 means done.
* @return formatted string to save to file
* Returns a user-friendly string representation of the task to display in the todolist.
* @return formatted string for display in list
* Represents a task that happens during a specific time period.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter PRINT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy, h a");
public EventTask(String description, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of this EventTask to save to data file.
* Format: E | 0/1 | description | start time | end time
* where 0 means not done and 1 means done.
* @return formatted string to save to file
* Returns a user-friendly string representation of the task to display in the todolist.
* @return formatted string for display in list
* Represents one task for the user to complete.
* Can be marked as done or not done.
* Creates a new task with the given description.
* Initially, the task is marked as not done.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns mark depending on whether task is done or not.
* @return "X" if task is done, otherwise a blank space
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving to the data file.
* Returns a user-friendly string representation of the task to display in the todolist.
* @return formatted string for display in list
* A type of task without any set deadline.
* Returns a string representation of this TodoTask to save to data file.
* where 0 means not done and 1 means done.
* @return formatted string to save to file
* Returns a user-friendly string representation of the task to display in the todolist.
* @return formatted string for display in list
* Handles the Ui interaction between the chatbot and the user.
* Greets the user upon loading the chatbot.
System.out.println("Good day to you! I'm Duchess.");
System.out.println("What can I do for you today?");
* Adds a dividing line between dialogue.
* Replies to user with given message.
* Closes scanner at end of program.
* JUnit tests for the deleteTask method in the TodoList class.
* Sets up a fresh TodoList with 3 tasks before each test.
* Tests that deleting a task at a certain valid index returns the correct task.
* Tests that deleting a task at a valid index reduces the size of the TodoList by 1.
* Tests that deleting a task at an invalid index throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException.
* Tests that deleting a task at a valid index shifts the remaining tasks correctly.
* JUnit tests for the EventTask class.
* Sets up a fresh EventTask before each test.
* Tests that toFileFormat() return the correct string when the task is not done.
* Tests that toFileFormat() returns the correct string when the task is done.
* Tests that toString() returns a correct and user-friendly representation including dates and mark.
String expected = "[E][ ] Group meeting (from: Feb 1 2026, 4 pm to: Feb 1 2026, 5 pm)";
